section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees at their discretion and convenience. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: The phrase "at their discretion and convenience" contradicts the statement that failure to pay in a timely manner will result in service interruption. This creates ambiguity regarding the payment terms. If the customer can pay at their convenience, it is unclear what constitutes a 'timely manner' and when service interruption would be justified. The first sentence imposes a strict monthly fee. The second sentence imposes a contradiction to the first sentence, giving the customer the option to follow the payment, at their discretion. The third sentence, introduces consequences of not following the first sentence, leading to further ambiguity.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon fifteen (15) days' written notice.
explanation: The first sentence states that the contract will automatically renew for 'one (1) or more one (1) month periods'. This is ambiguous. Does it renew for only one month, or potentially multiple months? The second sentence then allows either party to terminate the agreement with 15 days written notice. This creates an ambiguity because it is unclear if terminating the contract will override any possible 'one (1) or more (1) month periods'. This leaves room for interpretation. It is unclear if the 15 days notice will work in both cases.

section: i-on will be liable under any circumstances for any lost profits or other consequential damages, even if i-on has been advised as to the possibility of such damages. i-on's liability for damages to the Customer for any cause whatsoever, regardless of the form of action, and whether in contract or in tort, including negligence, shall be limited to one (1) month's fees and the remaining portion of any prepaid fees.
explanation: The first sentence states that i-on 'will be liable under any circumstances' then the second sentence limits the liability to one (1) month's fees. The first sentence is a clear contradiction to the second sentence. The two sentences cannot exist together.
